title: Colossians Chapter 3 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Colossians chapter 3 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Colossians Chapter 3 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Colossians Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3:1, where should believers set their minds if they have risen with Christ?
options: On things above where Christ sits at the right hand of God
questions.correctAnswer: On things above where Christ sits at the right hand of God
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:1 instructs believers to seek those things which are above, where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God.

questions.question: What does Colossians 3:5 say we should mortify or put to death?
options: Fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness
questions.correctAnswer: Fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:5 lists these specific sins as things to mortify because they are earthly and idolatrous.

questions.question: True or False: Colossians 3:8 tells us to put off anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, and filthy communication.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:8 clearly instructs believers to put off all these negative behaviors.

questions.question: What does Colossians 3:10 say the new man is renewed in?
options: Knowledge after the image of Him that created him
questions.correctAnswer: Knowledge after the image of Him that created him
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:10 describes the new man as being renewed in knowledge according to God's image.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Colossians 3:13: 'Forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any man have a quarrel against any: even as ________ forgave you, so also do ye.'
questions.correctAnswer: Christ
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:13 commands forgiveness as Christ forgave us.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3:15, what should rule in your hearts?
questions.correctAnswer: The peace of God
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:15 states that the peace of God should rule in believers' hearts.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3:16, how should the word of Christ dwell in you?
questions.correctAnswer: Richly in all wisdom
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:16 encourages believers to let the word of Christ dwell richly in them with wisdom.

questions.question: True or False: Colossians 3:19 instructs husbands to be bitter against their wives.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:19 commands husbands to love their wives and not be bitter against them.

questions.question: Who does Colossians 3:20 say should obey their parents in all things?
questions.correctAnswer: Children
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:20 instructs children to obey their parents in all things.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3:23, how should you do whatever you do?
options: Heartily, as to the Lord and not unto men
questions.correctAnswer: Heartily, as to the Lord and not unto men
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:23 instructs believers to do their work whole-heartedly as if for the Lord.

questions.question: What is the bond of perfectness mentioned in Colossians 3:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Charity
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:14 says that above all things, put on charity, which is the bond of perfectness.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3:18, who should wives submit to?
questions.correctAnswer: Their own husbands
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:18 instructs wives to submit to their own husbands as is fit in the Lord.

questions.question: True or False: Colossians 3:22 says servants should obey their masters only when being watched.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:22 instructs servants to obey their masters not with eye service as menpleasers, but sincerely fearing God.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3:11, which distinctions are removed in Christ?
options: Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian, Scythian, bond nor free
Rich and poor, male and female
Old and young, servant and master
Righteous and sinner, wise and foolish
questions.correctAnswer: Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian, Scythian, bond nor free
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:11 states that in Christ there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian, Scythian, bond nor free.

questions.question: What warning does Colossians 3:25 give about doing wrong?
options: He that doeth wrong shall receive for the wrong which he hath done
questions.correctAnswer: He that doeth wrong shall receive for the wrong which he hath done
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:25 warns that whoever does wrong will be repaid for their wrongdoing without respect of persons.

medium.title: Colossians Chapter 3 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Colossians Chapter 3 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling to focus on spiritual matters instead of earthly concerns. According to Colossians 3, what practical advice would you share?
options: Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth
Seek wealth and possessions to feel secure
Ignore spiritual things and focus on daily needs
questions.correctAnswer: Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:1-2 teaches believers to seek things above and set their affection on heavenly matters rather than earthly distractions, encouraging a focus on Christ who sits at God's right hand.

questions.question: What does Colossians 3 say about how Christians should deal with sinful behaviors like anger and malice?
options: Put off all these: anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication
Accept them as normal human emotions
Express them freely to relieve stress
Hide them but do not change
questions.correctAnswer: Put off all these: anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:8 instructs believers to actively put off sinful behaviors such as anger, wrath, and malice, reflecting a call to holy living and personal transformation.

questions.question: How should Christians treat one another when conflicts arise, based on Colossians 3?
options: Forgive each other as Christ forgave you
Hold grudges until the other person apologizes
Ignore the conflict and avoid each other
Seek revenge to be treated fairly
questions.correctAnswer: Forgive each other as Christ forgave you
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:13 teaches the importance of forbearing one another and forgiving one another, modeling Christ’s forgiveness as the standard.

questions.question: What is described as the bond of perfectness that Christians should 'put on' above all else?
questions.correctAnswer: Charity (love)
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:14 states that above all virtues, Christians should put on charity (love), which is described as the bond that perfects and unites believers.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3, what should rule in the hearts of believers?
questions.correctAnswer: The peace of God
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:15 encourages believers to let the peace of God rule in their hearts, fostering unity and thankfulness within the body of Christ.

questions.question: How does Colossians 3 instruct believers to engage with the word of Christ?
options: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another
Read it only occasionally when convenient
Focus on personal opinions rather than scripture
Use it as a tool to win arguments
questions.correctAnswer: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:16 emphasizes the importance of letting Christ’s word richly dwell in believers, encouraging mutual teaching and worship through spiritual songs.

questions.question: What attitude should believers have towards their work, according to Colossians 3?
options: Do it heartily, as to the Lord and not unto men
Do the minimum required to avoid punishment
Seek praise from others for your work
questions.correctAnswer: Do it heartily, as to the Lord and not unto men
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:23 instructs believers to work wholeheartedly as if serving the Lord, which encourages integrity and dedication regardless of human oversight.

questions.question: A Christian servant is tempted to serve only when watched by their master. What counsel from Colossians 3 would you offer?
options: Serve with singleness of heart, fearing God, not just to please men
Only serve when the master is present
Serve selfishly to gain personal benefit
Avoid serving to escape hard work
questions.correctAnswer: Serve with singleness of heart, fearing God, not just to please men
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:22 encourages servants to obey their earthly masters sincerely, with reverence for God rather than human approval, promoting sincere and faithful service.

questions.question: What instruction does Colossians 3 give to husbands in their relationship with their wives?
options: Love your wives and be not bitter against them
questions.correctAnswer: Love your wives and be not bitter against them
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:19 commands husbands to love their wives and avoid bitterness, reflecting Christ’s love and care within marriage.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3, how should children relate to their parents?
options: Obey your parents in all things, for this is well pleasing unto the Lord
Question all instructions given by parents
questions.correctAnswer: Obey your parents in all things, for this is well pleasing unto the Lord
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:20 teaches children to obey their parents fully as an act that pleases the Lord, emphasizing respect and submission.

questions.question: What warning does Colossians 3 give to fathers in their parenting?
options: Do not provoke your children to anger, lest they be discouraged
Be harsh and strict to control them
Allow children to do as they please
questions.correctAnswer: Do not provoke your children to anger, lest they be discouraged
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:21 warns fathers against provoking their children to anger, encouraging gentle and loving discipline to prevent discouragement.

questions.question: True or False: Colossians 3 teaches that Christians should lie to one another if it helps maintain peace.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:9 clearly commands believers not to lie to one another, emphasizing honesty as part of putting off the old self and living renewed in Christ.

questions.question: True or False: According to Colossians 3, Christ is all and in all, transcending all social and cultural distinctions.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:11 explains that distinctions such as Greek or Jew, circumcision or uncircumcision, bond or free, are irrelevant because Christ is all and in all.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Colossians 3:12 tells us to put on, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, ____________, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering.
questions.correctAnswer: bowels of mercies
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:12 describes compassionate qualities believers should clothe themselves with, specifically mentioning 'bowels of mercies' along with kindness and humility.

questions.question: What does Colossians 3 say about the motivation for doing all things in word or deed?
options: Do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him
Avoid doing anything that is difficult
questions.correctAnswer: Do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:17 teaches that all actions and words should be done in Jesus’ name with gratitude toward God, underscoring a heart of worship in daily life.

hard.title: Colossians Chapter 3 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Colossians Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3:1, where should believers seek the things that are above?
options: Where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God
On the earth where they live
questions.correctAnswer: Where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:1 instructs believers to seek things above, specifically where Christ sits at the right hand of God, indicating a position of authority and heavenly focus.

questions.question: What does the Greek word translated as 'mortify' in Colossians 3:5 imply in the context of this verse?
options: To put to death or put away
questions.correctAnswer: To put to death or put away
questions.explanation: The Greek word 'nekroō' translated as 'mortify' means to put to death or put away, symbolizing the believer's call to cease sinful behaviors as stated in Colossians 3:5.

questions.question: Colossians 3:11 emphasizes the unity of believers by stating there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision. What literary device is Paul using here?
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: Paul uses parallelism by pairing ethnic and cultural distinctions to emphasize the new identity in Christ that transcends former divisions (Colossians 3:11).

questions.question: In Colossians 3:12, Paul lists several virtues believers should 'put on.' Which of the following is NOT among them?
questions.correctAnswer: Pride
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:12 includes mercies, kindness, humbleness, meekness, and longsuffering, but not pride, which contradicts the humility encouraged.

questions.question: Colossians 3:14 states that charity is the bond of what?
questions.correctAnswer: Perfectness
questions.explanation: The verse clearly describes charity (love) as the bond of perfectness, signifying its role in uniting virtues into completeness.

questions.question: Which of the following best captures the theme of Colossians 3:3 regarding the believer's life?
options: Life is hidden with Christ in God
Life is a struggle against sin
questions.correctAnswer: Life is hidden with Christ in God
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:3 states that the believer's life is hidden with Christ in God, emphasizing spiritual security and union with Christ.

questions.question: How does Colossians 3:16 describe the role of the word of Christ within the community?
options: Dwelling richly in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another
Used only by the leaders for sermons
Kept as a sacred text without discussion
questions.correctAnswer: Dwelling richly in all wisdom, teaching and admonishing one another
questions.explanation: The verse highlights the communal and enriching role of Christ’s word, encouraging mutual teaching and spiritual singing.

questions.question: What is the cultural significance of the household codes in Colossians 3:18-21 in the context of the ancient Greco-Roman world?
options: They regulate social order and reflect Christian ethics within family structures
They promote rebellion against Roman authorities
They encourage economic independence from masters
questions.correctAnswer: They regulate social order and reflect Christian ethics within family structures
questions.explanation: These verses adapt Greco-Roman household codes to promote harmony and Christian virtues within the established social order.

questions.question: Colossians 3:24 connects service to earthly masters with service to whom?
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord Christ
questions.explanation: Paul teaches that serving earthly masters is ultimately serving the Lord Christ, indicating a higher spiritual accountability.

questions.question: True or False: Colossians 3:25 teaches that God shows favoritism when judging wrongdoers.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly states there is no respect of persons, meaning God judges all impartially.

questions.question: Colossians 3:13 calls believers to forgive one another as Christ forgave them. This reflects which Old Testament concept?
questions.correctAnswer: The Jubilee forgiveness of debts
questions.explanation: The concept of forgiveness mirrors the Jubilee year’s cancellation of debts, symbolizing grace and mercy extended to others.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Colossians 3:15 instructs believers to let the peace of God ______ in their hearts.
questions.correctAnswer: rule
questions.explanation: The verse uses the Greek word 'brabeuō' meaning to act as an umpire or ruler, indicating peace should govern the believer’s heart.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'new man' in Colossians 3:10 in light of Second Temple Judaism and Hellenistic influence?
options: It represents a renewed identity created in God’s image, transcending ethnic and social divisions
It refers to a new political leader
It is a metaphor for physical transformation
It signifies adopting Greek cultural practices
questions.correctAnswer: It represents a renewed identity created in God’s image, transcending ethnic and social divisions
questions.explanation: The 'new man' concept aligns with Jewish renewal themes and counters Hellenistic cultural distinctions by affirming identity in God’s image.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3:8, which of the following should believers put off?
options: Anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication
questions.correctAnswer: Anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, filthy communication
questions.explanation: The verse explicitly lists these negative behaviors as things believers must abandon.

questions.question: What does Paul emphasize about doing 'all in the name of the Lord Jesus' in Colossians 3:17?
options: That every word and deed should be done giving thanks to God
That it is acceptable to sin if done in Jesus' name
That only public acts are significant
questions.correctAnswer: That every word and deed should be done giving thanks to God
questions.explanation: Paul stresses comprehensive devotion and gratitude in all actions, reflecting submission to Christ’s authority.

theological.title: Colossians Chapter 3 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Colossians Chapter 3 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3:1, what should believers seek if they have been raised with Christ?
options: Things which are above, where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God
questions.correctAnswer: Things which are above, where Christ sitteth on the right hand of God
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:1 instructs believers who have risen with Christ to seek the things above, emphasizing a heavenly focus rather than earthly. This aligns with Matthew 6:33, Philippians 3:20, Romans 8:34, and Hebrews 1:3 which highlight Christ's exalted position and the believer's call to heavenly priorities.

questions.question: What does Colossians 3:3 say about the believer's life?
options: Your life is hid with Christ in God
Your life is hidden in earthly achievements
Your life is controlled by human effort
Your life is revealed through worldly success
questions.correctAnswer: Your life is hid with Christ in God
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:3 teaches that the believer's life is hidden with Christ in God, indicating union with Christ and spiritual security. This corresponds with John 17:21, Galatians 2:20, Ephesians 2:6, and Romans 6:5 where believers are united to Christ and share in His life.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed in Colossians 3:5 as something to mortify?
questions.correctAnswer: Pride
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:5 lists fornication, uncleanness, inordinate affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness (which is idolatry) as things to mortify. Pride is not specifically mentioned here but is addressed elsewhere, e.g., Proverbs 16:18, James 4:6, 1 Peter 5:5, highlighting the need for humility.

questions.question: What consequence does Colossians 3:6 associate with the sinful behaviors listed in verse 5?
options: The wrath of God comes on the children of disobedience
questions.correctAnswer: The wrath of God comes on the children of disobedience
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:6 states that God's wrath comes on those who live in disobedience, consistent with Romans 1:18, Ephesians 5:6, John 3:36, and Revelation 14:10 which affirm God's righteous judgment on sin.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3:8, which of the following is a behavior believers are commanded to put off?
questions.correctAnswer: Malice
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:8 commands believers to put off anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy, and filthy communication. This echoes Ephesians 4:31, 1 Peter 2:1, Proverbs 10:12, and Titus 3:3 which call for putting away malice and related sins.

questions.question: What does Colossians 3:10 say about the new man believers put on?
options: It is renewed in knowledge after the image of Him that created him
It is identical to the old man
questions.correctAnswer: It is renewed in knowledge after the image of Him that created him
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:10 describes the new man as being renewed in knowledge after God's image. This reflects the sanctifying work of God in believers and the restoration of the image of God as taught in Genesis 1:27, Ephesians 4:24, 2 Corinthians 3:18, and Romans 8:29.

questions.question: Colossians 3:11 emphasizes that in Christ there is no distinction between which groups?
options: Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian, Scythian, bond nor free
Rich nor poor, male nor female
Young nor old, servant nor master
Gentile nor Pharisee, slave nor free
questions.correctAnswer: Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, Barbarian, Scythian, bond nor free
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:11 stresses the unity in Christ beyond ethnic, cultural, and social distinctions, reflecting Galatians 3:28, Ephesians 2:14-16, Romans 10:12, and 1 Corinthians 12:13 where all believers are one in Christ.

questions.question: Which character traits are believers exhorted to 'put on' in Colossians 3:12?
options: Mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering
questions.correctAnswer: Mercies, kindness, humbleness of mind, meekness, longsuffering
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:12 calls believers to clothe themselves with compassion, kindness, humility, meekness, and patience, reflecting Christlike virtues also emphasized in Ephesians 4:32, Philippians 2:3-4, 1 Peter 3:8, and Galatians 5:22-23.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3:13, believers are commanded to forgive one another as Christ did. What is the condition mentioned for this forgiveness?
options: If any man have a quarrel against any
Only if the offense is minor
questions.correctAnswer: If any man have a quarrel against any
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:13 teaches forgiveness without condition except the presence of a quarrel or offense, mirroring Christ's forgiveness and paralleling Matthew 6:14-15, Ephesians 4:32, Luke 17:3-4, and Mark 11:25.

questions.question: What is described as 'the bond of perfectness' in Colossians 3:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Charity (love)
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:14 calls love the bond of perfectness, highlighting its supreme role in Christian unity and maturity, consistent with 1 Corinthians 13:13, John 13:34-35, Romans 13:10, and 1 John 4:8.

questions.question: According to Colossians 3:15, what should rule in the hearts of believers?
questions.correctAnswer: The peace of God
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:15 instructs believers to let God's peace rule in their hearts, emphasizing spiritual tranquility and unity as taught in Philippians 4:7, John 14:27, Romans 5:1, and Isaiah 26:3.

questions.question: What does Colossians 3:16 say should dwell richly in believers?
questions.correctAnswer: The word of Christ
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:16 exhorts believers to let the word of Christ dwell richly, highlighting the importance of Scripture for teaching and worship, consistent with 2 Timothy 3:16, Psalm 119:11, James 1:21, and Hebrews 4:12.

questions.question: How does Colossians 3:17 instruct believers to do everything?
options: In the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father
questions.correctAnswer: In the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:17 commands that all actions be done in Jesus' name with thanksgiving to God, emphasizing Christ's lordship and gratitude, as echoed in Ephesians 5:20, 1 Corinthians 10:31, Philippians 4:6, and Hebrews 13:15.

questions.question: What instruction does Colossians 3:18 give specifically to wives?
options: Submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord
Prioritize earthly desires above God's will
questions.correctAnswer: Submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the Lord
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:18 instructs wives to submit to their husbands as appropriate in the Lord, reflecting a biblical ordering of family relationships consistent with Ephesians 5:22, 1 Peter 3:1-6, Titus 2:4-5, and 1 Corinthians 11:3.

questions.question: What is the command given to children in Colossians 3:20?
options: Obey your parents in all things, for this is well pleasing unto the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Obey your parents in all things, for this is well pleasing unto the Lord
questions.explanation: Colossians 3:20 commands children to obey parents fully as this pleases God, aligning with Exodus 20:12, Ephesians 6:1-3, Proverbs 1:8, and Deuteronomy 5:16 which emphasize honoring parents as a divine mandate.
